scenes.text: In 1519, a Spanish conquistador named Hernán Cortés landed in Mexico with 600 men to face millions of Aztecs.

Right side: an overwhelming mass of Aztec warriors with green quetzal feather headdresses and red-blue-yellow macaw plumes, jaguar skin cloaks, and face paint stretching to the horizon. The contrast in numbers is dramatic. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
